name: ColorMath.Scaling

values.name: darken
values.comment:
Given a decimal value *x* between 0 and 1 and a `Color`, returns an updated
`Color` with the lightness *L* decreased proportionally by the formula:

    L - (x * L)

values.name: desaturate
values.comment:
Given a decimal value *x* between 0 and 1 and a `Color`, returns an updated
`Color` with the saturation *S* decreased proportionally by the formula:

    S - (x * S)

values.name: lighten
values.comment:
Given a decimal value *x* between 0 and 1 and a `Color`, returns an updated
`Color` with the lightness *L* increased proportionally by the formula:

    L + ( x * (1 - L) )

values.name: moreOpaque
values.comment:
Given a decimal value *x* between 0 and 1 and a `Color`, returns an updated
`Color` with the alpha *A* increased proportionally by the formula:

    A + ( x * (1 - A) )

values.name: moreTransparent
values.comment:
Given a decimal value *x* between 0 and 1 and a `Color`, returns an updated
`Color` with the alpha *A* decreased proportionally by the formula:

    A - (x * A)

values.name: rotateHue
values.comment:
Given a decimal value *x* between -1 and 1 and a `Color`, returns an updated
`Color` with the hue rotated by _(x * 360)_ degrees, as represented on a color
wheel

values.name: saturate
values.comment:
Given a decimal value *x* between 0 and 1 and a `Color`, returns an updated
`Color` with the saturation *S* increased proportionally by the formula:

    S + ( x * (1 - S) )

values.name: scaleToAqua
values.comment:
Given a decimal value *x* between 0 and 1 and a `Color`, returns an updated
`Color` with the hue *H* scaled proportionally toward aqua by the formula:

    if H <= 180 then
      H + ( x * (180 - H) )
    else
      H - ( x * (H - 180) )

values.name: scaleToRed
values.comment:
Given a decimal value *x* between 0 and 1 and a `Color`, returns an updated
`Color` with the hue *H* scaled proportionally toward red by the formula:

    if H >= 180 then
      H + ( x * (360 - H) )
    else
      H - (x * H)

name: ColorMath.Hex8
comment:
# Converting To and From 8-Digit Hexadecimal Color Codes
- 8-digit color codes include a hexadecimal encoding of the alpha channel
- Just like typical color codes, they can be abbreviated to 4 digits so that
"#FFFFFFFF" becomes "#FFFF"
- 8-digit codes are supported in Firefox and Chrome > 52
- Read about pros and cons [here](https://css-tricks.com/8-digit-hex-codes/)

@docs fromColor, toColor

values.name: fromColor
values.comment:
Given a `Color`, returns the equivalent hexademimal color code as an
8-character string, with the alpha channel represented by the last two
characters

values.name: toColor
values.comment:
Converts a string containing a 4- or 8-digit hexadecimal color code
to a `Color`

- Returns an error message if the string argument is not valid
hexadecimal notation, or contains an incorrect number of digits.
- The hex code may be given with or without a leading "#".

name: ColorMath.Hsla

values.name: getAlpha
values.comment:
Given a `Color`, returns its alpha channel as a decimal value between 0 and
1

values.name: getHue
values.comment:
Given a `Color`, returns its hue as a decimal value between 0 and 360,
representing degrees on a color wheel

- Note that the standard Elm representation of hue in the `Color` module is in
radians rather than degrees. Degrees are used in this package for compatibility
with CSS and for the sake of human readability.

values.name: getLightness
values.comment: Given a `Color`, returns its lightness as a decimal value between 0 and 1

values.name: getSaturation
values.comment: Given a `Color`, returns its saturation as a decimal value between 0 and 1

values.name: setAlpha
values.comment:
Given a decimal value between 0 and 1 and a `Color`, returns an updated
`Color` with the alpha channel set to the input value

values.name: setHue
values.comment:
Given a decimal value between 0 and 360 (representing degrees on a color
wheel) and a `Color`, returns an updated `Color` with the hue set to the input
value

values.name: setLightness
values.comment:
Given a decimal value between 0 and 1 and a `Color`, returns an updated
`Color` with the lightness set to the input value

values.name: setSaturation
values.comment:
Given a decimal value between 0 and 1 and a `Color`, returns an updated
`Color` with the saturation set to the input value

values.name: toColor
values.comment:
Converts a record containing HSLA components to a
[`Color`](http://package.elm-lang.org/packages/elm-lang/core/latest/Color#Color).

name: ColorMath.Rgba

values.name: getAlpha
values.comment:
Given a `Color`, returns its alpha channel as a decimal value between 0 and
1

values.name: getBlue
values.comment: Given a `Color`, returns the value of its blue channel

values.name: getGreen
values.comment: Given a `Color`, returns the value of its green channel

values.name: getRed
values.comment: Given a `Color`, returns the value of its red channel

values.name: setAlpha
values.comment:
Given a decimal value between 0 and 1 and a `Color`, returns an updated
`Color` with the alpha channel set to the input value

values.name: setBlue
values.comment:
Given an integer value from 0 to 255 and a `Color`, returns an
updated `Color` with the blue channel set to the input value

values.name: setGreen
values.comment:
Given an integer value from 0 to 255 and a `Color`, returns an
updated `Color` with the green channel set to the input value

values.name: setRed
values.comment:
Given an integer value from 0 to 255 and a `Color`, returns an
updated `Color` with the red channel set to the input value

values.name: toColor
values.comment:
Converts a record containing RGBA components to a
[`Color`](http://package.elm-lang.org/packages/elm-lang/core/latest/Color#Color).

name: ColorMath.Hex
comment:
# Converting To and From Hexadecimal Color Codes
- Hex codes are widely used in CSS, but are not currently supported by the
*elm-lang/core* `Color` module
- This module provides a convenient way to convert hex codes (e.g., for
additional color processing within an Elm program), or to output color
identifiers in a compact format (e.g., when creating a color tool that would
allow users to cut and paste color codes). 

@docs fromInt, fromColor, toColor

values.name: fromColor
values.comment:
Given a `Color`, returns its equivalent hexademimal color code as a
6-character string, with the alpha channel ignored

values.name: fromInt
values.comment:
Given an integer between 0 and 255, returns its equivalent in base-16
notation

  - Negative input returns "00"
  - Input greater than 255 returns "FF"

values.name: toColor
values.comment:
Converts a string containing a 3- or 6-digit hexadecimal color code
to a `Color`

- Returns an error message if the string argument is not valid
hexadecimal notation, or contains an incorrect number of digits.
- The hex code may be given with or without a leading "#".

name: ColorMath
comment:
This package includes functions for getting and setting individual
[RGBA](http://package.elm-lang.org/packages/danielnarey/elm-color-math/latest/ColorMath-Rgba)
and
[HSLA](http://package.elm-lang.org/packages/danielnarey/elm-color-math/latest/ColorMath-Hsla)
color components, functions for
[relative color scaling](http://package.elm-lang.org/packages/danielnarey/elm-color-math/latest/ColorMath-Scaling)
by hue, saturation, lightness, and alpha, and functions for converting among
color representations, including
[converting hexadecimal color codes](http://package.elm-lang.org/packages/danielnarey/elm-color-math/latest/ColorMath-Hex)
to Elm `Color` values and vice versa.

# Intermediate Color Representations
@docs Rgba, Hsla

aliases.name: Hsla
aliases.comment:
Represents the components of an HSLA color value. This is an alias for the
type returned when `Color.toHsl` is called.
aliases.type: { hue : Float, saturation : Float, lightness : Float, alpha : Float }

aliases.name: Rgba
aliases.comment:
Represents the components of an RGBA color value. This is an alias for the
type returned when `Color.toRgb` is called.
aliases.type: { red : Int, green : Int, blue : Int, alpha : Float }
